data.title: COMPANY NEWS; PENTAIR CUTS 400 JOBS AT TOOL UNIT AND HEADQUARTERS
data.meta_description: Pentair Inc, maker of power tools, says it has cut 400 jobs since end of third quarter and that its first-quarter earnings will be better than estimates; says 340 of jobs came from closing down production in last two weeks of December and first two weeks of January; also says it has cut half staff at its headquarters, closed executive offices in Minneapolis and moved operations to its offices in St Paul; says actions will save about $20 million annually (S)
data.text: Pentair Inc., a maker of power tools and electrical equipment, said yesterday that it had cut 400 jobs since the end of the third quarter and that its first-quarter earnings would be better than estimates. The company said 340 of the jobs came from its tools unit, where it closed production the last two weeks of December and the first two weeks of January. Pentair employs 13,000 people. The company also said it cut half the staff at its headquarters, closed executive offices in Minneapolis and moved the operations to its offices in St. Paul. Pentair said its actions would save about $20 million a year.
